data.meta_description: JUNIOR SKILLS CHALLENGE The Junior Skills Challenge is an interactive programme focusing on the core skills of golf through engaging challenges that encourage juniors to develop within a competitive environment. What is the Junior Skills Challenge? The challenge is open to juniors under the age of 15 in the following categories with a Boys and [â€¦]
data.text:
The challenge is open to juniors under the age of 15 in the following categories with a Boys and Girls category in each:

Participants aged 6 and under

Participants aged 7-9

Participants aged 10-12

Participants aged 13-15

Please note, the age of the player on 1st January should be used to determine age category/eligibility.

The aim for juniors is to accumulate as many points as possible in Putting, Chipping and Driving. Using the online leaderboard, you and your juniors will be able to measure progress as well as track regional and national rankings.

For more information and support with the Skills Challenge at your club, contact us at juniorgolf@scottishgolf.org

All clubs in Scotland are invited to register for the Junior Skills Challenge, which will enable your juniors to be added to the National Leaderboard.

During the 2024 season, we will have a number of exciting online competitions for your juniors to take part in:

New Season Opener Challenge (by 30th April)

Scottish Open Challenge (by 31st May)

The Open Challenge (by 28th June)

To enter your juniors, sign up for the event using the link below and ensure all scores are uploaded within your Club Account.

Login to your club account to register for the Junior Skills Challenge, upload scores and access the supporting resources.

If you require further help with taking part in the Junior Skills Challenge or running a Skills Challenge Event at your club, please contact juniorgolf@scottishgolf.org
